translated: If there are good men and good women who, having heard the name of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Lotus Flower Supreme Auspiciousness, and the name of the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Lotus Flower Hand, are able to chant and uphold it, then when they are reborn they will attain the wisdom of recollecting past lives, and from then on they will always be reborn from a lotus flower. translated: Kāśyapa!

original: 是人能於天人世間一切辯才之中，不為他所退怯間斷，常得語言辯才無斷。
analyzed: 是人能於天人世間一切辯才之中，不為他所退怯間斷，常得語言辯才無斷。
translated: This person will be able to speak with eloquence in all the worlds of devas and humans, and will not be intimidated or interrupted by others, and will always attain uninterrupted eloquence.

original: 又善男子及善女人，若能稱念彼佛名者，是人聽法之時，得佛聖相為現其前，若於諸法昔所未聞，隨所受學，即時獲得無邊俱胝那庾多百千隨轉陀羅尼；
analyzed: 又善男子及善女人，若能稱念彼佛名者，是人聽法之時，得佛聖相為現其前，若於諸法昔所未聞，隨所受學，即時獲得無邊俱胝那庾多百千隨轉陀羅尼；
translated: Moreover, if good men and good women are able to chant the name of that Buddha, when they listen to the Dharma, they will attain the holy appearance of the Buddha appearing before them. If they have not heard certain teachings in the past, according to what they receive and study, they will immediately attain the dhāraṇī of boundless koṭīs of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of transformations.

original: 又此閻浮提中，一切有情隨所樂求而悉能知，然後如其信解善為說法，當得不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，阿僧祇俱胝那庾多百千劫中背於生死，而能攝集無量福蘊。
analyzed: 又此閻浮提中，一切有情隨所樂求而悉能知，然後如其信解善為說法，當得不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，阿僧祇俱胝那庾多百千劫中背於生死，而能攝集無量福蘊。
translated: Moreover, in this Jambudvīpa, they will be able to know all the things that sentient beings seek according to their desires, and then they will skillfully expound the Dharma according to their understanding and faith. They will attain irreversibility from supreme perfect enlightenment, and for asaṃkhyeya koṭīs of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of eons they will turn their backs on saṃsāra and be able to gather immeasurable accumulations of merit.

original: 佛說大乘大方廣佛冠經卷上
analyzed: 佛說大乘大方廣佛冠經卷上
translated: The Buddha Speaks the Sūtra of the Great Vehicle, the Great Collection of Buddhas, Scroll 1
